title: Trump says Turkey's ceasefire in northern Syria now permanent
text:
U.S. President Donald Trump delivers a statement on the conflict in Syria in the Diplomatic Room of the White House in Washington, U.S., October 23, 2019. REUTERS/Tom Brenner

WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Donald Trump on Wednesday said that Turkey has said it is stopping combat and making a ceasefire in northern Syria permanent, prompting the United States to lift recent sanctions it had imposed on Turkish imports in response to the violence.

“The sanctions will be lifted unless something happens that we are not happy with,” Trump said in a special address from the White House where he also cast skepticism about the meaning of “permanent” in “that part of the world.”
